home.welcome_message: Welcome to Dojo KIME, a space dedicated to Traditional Shotokan Karate, inspired by the teachings of Hidetaka Nishiyama. Here, we not only refine technique but also cultivate discipline, respect, and harmony between body, mind, and spirit. Our approach follows karate as a comprehensive martial path (budo), where each student has the opportunity to discover and develop their best self.

ourPhilosophy.philosophyText: At KIME Dojo, we believe that Karate is much more than a martial art: it is a way of life. Inspired by the principles of budo, we integrate physical, mental, and spiritual development. Here, you will not only learn self-defense but also discover how humility, perseverance, and respect can transform every aspect of your life.
ourPhilosophy.approachText: Each class is designed to go beyond physical movements and immerse you in the essence of Traditional Shotokan Karate.
ourPhilosophy.techniqueText: Attention to detail and perfection in every movement, backed by principles of biomechanics.
ourPhilosophy.disciplineText: Development of character and spirit through constant effort.
ourPhilosophy.communityText: An environment of mutual respect and support among practitioners of all ages and levels.
ourPhilosophy.imageCaption: Master Hidetaka Nishiyama, inspiration behind KIME Dojo.

association.title: Association
association.description: KIME Dojo is part of the Budo Karate Association, an organization founded by Sensei Avi Rokah, 8th Dan and a direct student of Sensei Hidetaka Nishiyama. The association's main purpose is to provide a platform for the preservation and development of Budo Karate, based on the principles taught by Sensei Nishiyama.

structure.title: CLASS STRUCTURE
structure.description: Our classes provide balanced training focused on technical, physical, and philosophical aspects of Traditional Shotokan Karate. Each session follows a structured approach:

salutation.title: Greeting and Preparation
salutation.description: We start each class with a bow and meditation to focus and leave distractions outside the dojo.

warmup.title: Warm-up and Mobility
warmup.description: Dynamic exercises to prepare the body, prevent injuries, and improve flexibility.

kihon.title: Kihon (Basic Techniques)
kihon.description: Training in stances, strikes, blocks, and kicks with emphasis on precision and biomechanics.

kata.title: Kata (Forms)
kata.description: Practicing traditional forms, combining technique, rhythm, and power.

kumite.title: Kumite (Sparring)
kumite.description: Partner drills focusing on coordination, control, and self-defense.

reflection.title: Reflection & Closing
reflection.description: Each session ends with stretching and a review of lessons learned.

questions.question: What do I need to bring to my first class?
questions.answer: For your first class, you only need comfortable clothes to move in and a willingness to learn. Later, you can get a uniform (karategi), which is mandatory for regular training.

questions.question: Are the classes mixed-gender?
questions.answer: Yes, our classes are open to everyone, regardless of gender, in an inclusive and respectful environment.

questions.question: Do I need prior experience?
questions.answer: No, our classes are designed for both beginners and advanced practitioners. Instructors adjust the teaching based on each student's level.

questions.question: What benefits does karate have for children?
questions.answer: Traditional Karate helps children develop discipline, self-confidence, motor coordination, and focus while learning values such as respect and perseverance.

questions.question: What happens if I can't attend all the classes?
questions.answer: We understand that commitments may arise. While we recommend regular attendance for continuous progress, you can resume classes whenever possible.

registrationFAQs.title: FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS
registrationFAQs.where_is_dojo_answer: The dojo is located at Estadio Corfo Las Condes.
registrationFAQs.need_to_belong: Do I need to belong to Corfo to practice?
registrationFAQs.need_to_belong_answer: No, the dojo is open to everyone. You do not need to belong to any organization to enroll.
registrationFAQs.can_i_come_without_registering_answer: Ideally, no. At the stadium entrance, they might ask for your details, so it's better to register beforehand to avoid issues.
registrationFAQs.how_to_contact: If I have a question, how do I contact you?
registrationFAQs.how_to_contact_answer: You can email us at info@kime.cl or send us a WhatsApp message at +56 9 9999 9999.
registrationFAQs.can_register_with_teacher: Can I register directly with the teacher?
registrationFAQs.can_register_with_teacher_answer: No, our instructors are focused on teaching classes. Registrations must be done through the website.
registrationFAQs.class_cost: What is the cost of the classes?
registrationFAQs.class_cost_answer:
The monthly fee is:
• $60,000 for children and youth (up to 23 years old).
• $80,000 for adults.
No registration fee.
